alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 11:24PM EDT until July 25 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT MONDAY FOR DAVIESS, SOUTHWESTERN GREENE, NORTHEASTERN KNOX AND SOUTHERN SULLIVAN COUNTIES... At 1124 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vincennes, Washington, Bicknell, Lyons, Carlisle, Elnora, Oaktown, Wheatland, Bruceville, Plainville, Sandborn, Montgomery, Edwardsport, Merom, Cannelburg, Alfordsville, Freelandville, Pleasantville, Paxton and Vincennes University. Some area highways are impassable in spots, with reports of some vehicles becoming stranded. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
